pros: Great place to work cares about employees
cons: I have no negative reviews

pros: Close to home hospital in a rural area
cons: Benefits are terrible, including insurance. Pay doesn’t line up across the board with the rest of the country. Employees in different departments are held to different standards, although everyone is set to follow “companywide policy.”

review_title: people are nice, pay is bad
pros: nice coworkers and flexible hours in my position
cons: not compensated fairly, this could improve.

pros: Coworkers are wonderful in the UCC.
cons: If you choose to work in Urgent Care be prepared to float to all locations at a moments notice.

pros: Small town hospital. Flexibility on scheduling.
cons: Lack of adequate and continuing education.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Gallipolis, OH
pros: None. It’s a toxic environment.
cons: Everything-pay is far below market value, favoritism is the order of business.

pros: Most positions offer a nice income for our rural area.
cons: May be required to fill in at the main campus 35 miles away if census is high or staffing is low.

pros: Coworkers, newer facility is nice.
cons: Low pay, high turnover across the board.

pros: Good insurance benefits when I worked there.
cons: Dept. was short staffed a lot of the time.

pros: Huge family atmosphere among the workforce. People that care about their community and thrive on being part of the greater good for each other. Insurance benefits are excellent comparatively. Workforce flexibility is also a huge pro.
cons: Staffing remains a stressor in recruiting skilled people to rural Appalachia.

job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Charleston, WV
pros: They never lay people off, treat each other like family, I am on a great team
cons: pay could be better and more competitive

review_title: Great place to work, just wish it had better pay
pros: Good work life balance, great co workers.
cons: Pay and cost of insurance

pros: Nothing worth mentioning here .
cons:
-Pay is terrible
-No raises
-HR department is worthless, any issues brought to them get swept under the rug and ignored.
-Nepotism runs rampant, just take a look at the organizational structure and see how many last names match up
-Way too many managers
-Absolutely abysmal insurance and benefits, I worked full time and it was cheaper to NOT use my insurance for medical visits and prescriptions....working at a hospital

pros: This location is close to home
cons: They have low pay rates, for NP's

pros: Some quality providers and staff that put their lives into their jobs.
cons: Many poor administration/management that don’t get rid of the lazy staff, but will work the good ones to death. It’s all about “the good ol’ boys club”. If your part of the club or related to the boys in the club you’ll go far. Otherwise they real don’t give a crap about you.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Jackson, OH
pros: There is no pros to working here.
cons: Pay is below average with no raises even taking to people who have been with the hospital for more than five years are still at new grad pay. Hospital is always short staffed to the point where nurses are doing full care on all assigned patients, or nurses will have more patients than what is safe for patient care. Upper management is nowhere to be found and is so out of touch on how floors are run its scary. Even working on the COVID floor plastic walls were not up held and half the year was falling without replacement, half of patient rooms do not have hot water, there are cracks in the walls, paint peeling in bathrooms, TV's are from the 70's and barely pick up stations. Would not recommend unless you REALLY need a job.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Pomeroy, OH
pros: Decent pay, Nice, Clean facility
cons: Manager A.A. Exhibits Poor management skills and fails to protect employee confidentiality. Does not perform periodic reviews and accrues negative data on an employee then dumps it on them all at once. Very unfair management practices.

pros: None to be talked about
cons: Nothing good came of this job.

review_title: Ok company to start out with
pros: Nice people to work for
cons: Low pay scale for job title

pros: the work schedule is good
cons: Only one raise in 3 years

job_title: Registered Nurse in Point Pleasant, WV
pros: Love my coworkers. They are amazing.
cons: I don’t feel we get the appreciation we deserve.

pros: Close to home, great local members of the community, give back to the community, good atmosphere
cons: Do not have any at all.

pros: Very friendly teams and great doctors
cons: Pay was mediocre back then

pros:
Training on site
Fast paced
Great learning experience
cons:
Not the best management 
Some drama between employees

pros: Decent pay and benefits. The health insurance is great and decently priced. Discount membership to the health and fitness center.
cons: They frequently overlook and ignore problems reported by non management staff. Management has no idea what really happens on the floors and the way they manage definitely shows that.  Favoritism is also a big issue here, managers hiring friends or family and not even trying to hide the special treatment they receive. Some employees would get written up for things while the employees that were friends with management wouldn’t get written up for the same things. Long story short, they don’t care about their employees as much as they’d like you to think they do.

review_title: Terrible Administration, financially sinking, do not work there
pros: Great salary and benefits. Direct supervisors and co-workers were great (supportive, friendly, professional, competent). The hospital itself as a building was/is nice and clean. Almost everyone was/is nice and friendly. Most of the paperwork is electronic so it's fast and efficient.
cons: Administration does not know how to run a hospital. They are bleeding money left and right and don't know what the right hand is doing from the left. They are not in compliance with State Regulations and don't seem to care. They are millions of dollars in the hole and laid off almost 100 employees in 10/2015 so there is no job security. Morale is very low.

pros: Friendly Staff, Flexible managers, amazing medical benefits. If you choose the high plan the insurance pays 90% and they write off the other 10%. All meds through Holzer's Pharmacy are $3 generic and $7 formulary. If you have or had a chronic illness like mine (Cancer) it makes a world of difference knowing you won't be swallowed by debt.
cons: It's low pay. I made $14.47 at Lowe's and $10.47 at Holzer.

pros: I felt the benefits were nice. Holzer Health Systems were good about keeping staff trained and contributing to on-going training
cons: The Holzer Health Systems failed to keep their patience happy. The goal went from the patience to the patience's money and our prestige, or lack of rather. LL

review_title: Keeps you at part time unless you are degreed in the medical field
pros: You get to help patients in some manner
cons: Peer community is brutally competitive, bosses look down on subordinates and treat them badly, HR offers no help and protects those who are abusive in higher up positions.

pros: Medical benefits are great comparatively to industry.  Very friendly work atmosphere and genuine focus on balance and family.  Community is small town America - small, safe and affordable.
cons: Holzer needs more in qualified workforce and therefore are often looking to fill new positions.

pros: Benefits were fairly good, under most conditions it was a good place to work.
cons: People in the hourly rated fields were not treated as part of the company, especially if you made a mistake.

job_title: RN Charge Nurse in Athens, OH
pros: Clean Facility, Modern. Friendly Staff and doctors.Would be a great place to work if they had taken care of their employees.
cons: No raises in 5 years. No payment by employer into retirement plan for 5 years. May be in financial straights.

pros: Close to home.  I have to write 20 words here but there is no other pro.
cons: Far from everything.  Low pay and no raises.  Supervisors in lab retired and were not replaced leading to a dead end job for me.  I moved away and was promoted to a supervisor in 5 months after 3 years of this night shift dead end place. If you have another option please do yourself a favor and take it!

pros: Family friendly atmosphere. Great cafeteria food.
cons: Need to concentrate on benefits and perks for nursing staff. They are the backbone of the hospital. Make it worth staying and you will have experienced, seasoned and happy nurses.

job_title: Senior Certified Pharmacy Technician in Gallipolis, OH
pros: I love our Patients and the people I worked with.
cons: Management changed a lot the first year I was there. It definitely got better with last manager we had before I left.

pros: Best staff to work with. Patient population that we serve are very good. Work environment is great
cons: Shaky financial situation of the system
